chapter.title: Building WriterDaemon
chapter.para: This chapter describes how to build WriterDaemon and its associated documentation. If you are using a binary distribution of WriterDaemon you can skip this section. The tools with specific version numbers shown below are the official tools used by the WriterDaemon contributors. Other tools (or other versions of the same tools) may also work. Obviously the greater the differences between the tools you attempt to use and those listed below the more trouble you are likely to encounter during the build process.

listitem.para: We use IntelliJ IDEA v15.0.4 with the Scala plugin as our integrated development environment.
We use Scala v2.11.7. The Scala compiler is executed indirectly via IntelliJ IDEA Currently no official method of building WriterDaemon outside the IDE is provided.

The documentation is written in DocBook. This is an XML format and so is readable in an ordinary text editor. However, if you want to build nicely formatted documentation you will need a tool chain for processing DocBook documents. Several such tool chains exist.

chapter.para: See the README.md file in the root of the project folder for specific details about setting up IntelliJ IDEA and building the WriterDaemon system.
